div1.p: Carter thanks Russell for supplying the Connor reference she sought and describes her work at the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, February 1, 1920
div1.opener:
Book, Misel
Russell, a) Report
b) Bibliographic
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
February 1, 1930.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
Thank you very much indeed for your letter of January 24th.,
containing the quotation from Dr. Connor's “Preliminary Report on Yellow
Fever in Merida, Yucatan, Mexico” dated 1921, re aljibea as breeding
places for “Stegomyia.” It is just what we wanted and I am greatly
your debtor for sending me so satisfactory and comprehensive an extract.

(a) I presume that this “Preliminary Report” of Connor's is
only to be found among the archives of your Division and that our bib-
liographic reference should be made accordingly. (b) If, however, it
was published subsequent to 1921, we ought, in our bibliography, to give
the routine references (name of Journal: place and date of publication:
pagination, inclusive and also specific for the quotation) and I would
appreciate it if your office would supply this information.
Good news from Dr. Frost, who says, in a letter of January 29th:

“Mrs. Smiley is making good progress on copying the manuscript
and I will be able to send you very soon the first section and a part
of the third.” According to this, Miss Brown and I should be able to
begin our part of the proof reading in the comparatively near future.

Since my letter of January. 20th., I have put in some satisfactory
work at the Library of Congress, besides returning some of their books,
which I had at my apartment: renewing others and, of course, taking out
still others.

I expect to send Dr. Frost some additional material as soon as
I can type it. Was too sick to sit up part of this week, but did a lot
of reading and note taking lying on the sofa, re “fièvre inflammatoire;
Lizana'a “Historia de Yucatan” etc. etc. The time wasn't lost then, al-
al-

though I had taken up other things first had I been well enough to do
so.

Once more, with sincere appreciation of the assistance ren-
dered us in your letter of January 24th., I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (Signed) Laura A. Carter. Dr. Frederick F. Russell,
Director,
International Health Division
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
